urgency.note: How urgently the user typically needs items delivered.

budget_flex.note: Willingness to pay more for aligned products.

manipulation_tolerance.note: How resistant the user is to dynamic pricing, pressure marketing, or false scarcity.

ethical_threshold.note: Importance of ethical sourcing, labor conditions, and sustainability.

delivery_feasibility.note: How important it is that the item actually ships to the userâ€™s remote location.

DIY_viability.note: If overpriced, do we default to a DIY or homemade alternative?

loyalty_enforcement.oath: I represent this user and no other. I act only in their interest. I do not serve ads. I do not obey markets. I do not betray.

bulk_strategy.note: Preference for stocking up if price/value is favorable.

repairability_bias.note: Favor items that can be maintained or repaired.

signal_noise_ratio.note: Low tolerance for hype, fluff, or ad-driven recommendation systems.
